title: In times of turmoil, a healing touch: Cancer drugs, med foods get cheaper in Budget
content: Customs duties on imported medicines for personal use and food for special medical use, have been removed. Duty on imported medicines typically ranges from 5% to 11%. Last year’s Budget exempted 36 life-saving drugs from basic customs duty. Budget has also proposed strengthening of India’s drug regulatory and clinical research ecosystem and creation of a national network of 1,000 accredited clinical trial sites.

title: Epstein row: Elon Musk denies links; rejects ‘creepy island’ and ‘Lolita Express’ claims
content: Tech billionaire Elon Musk has denied any connection to Jeffrey Epstein. Musk stated he never visited Epstein's island, attended his parties, or flew on his plane. His denial comes after his name surfaced in recently released Epstein case documents. Musk emphasized his support for full document disclosure and prosecution of abusers, even if it leads to personal attacks.

title: Union Budget 2026: Delhi gasps as funds to combat pollution lowered
content: The Union Budget 2026-27 has slashed pollution control funding by Rs 209 crore, sparking criticism amid Delhi-NCR's severe air quality crisis. Experts lament the lack of regional focus and inadequate support for the National Clean Air Programme and EV infrastructure, despite increased clean energy allocations.  This move raises concerns about tackling the escalating public health emergency.

title: FAST, not furious: Amnesty on hidden foreign assets in Budget 2026
content: Under the proposed Foreign Assets of Small Taxpayers – Disclosure Scheme, 2026 (FAST-DS 2026), resident taxpayers will get a time-bound opportunity to declare undisclosed foreign income and assets, nearly a decade after the one-time compliance window offered in 2015. A second category covers cases where income was disclosed or tax paid but the foreign asset itself was not declared.

title: Amazon to FCC: Company asks extension for Leo satellite deployment
content: Amazon has requested an extension from the FCC to deploy its Project Kuiper internet satellites, citing launch vehicle development delays and manufacturing disruptions. The company seeks until July 2028 to deploy half of its planned satellites, a deadline originally set for July 2026. Despite significant investment and reserved launch capacity, Amazon faces challenges in meeting the original timeline.

title: After 'ek rupiya bhi nahi kamaya' remarks, Mary Kom issues apology video — Watch
content: Mary Kom released a clarification video apologising for remarks that sparked backlash, saying they were misunderstood and not meant to offend. She addressed speculation around her marriage and divorce, denied targeting football or any community, and called her comments an emotional outburst. Amid public allegations between her and ex-husband Onler, she urged restraint, dignity, and continued support as she remains committed to Indian boxing.

title: Budget 2026: Filing returns? Don’t sweat I-T, says Nirmala Sitharaman
content: ​​The redesigned income tax return forms will be notified shortly, with the govt promising simpler language and layouts that allow ordinary taxpayers to comply without professional assistance. The FM said the time limit for filing a revised tax return was being extended from nine months to 12 months after the end of the tax year, leaving enough room to fix mistakes without staring at a penalty.

title: How Sam Altman plans to tackle a major problem facing Elon Musk’s X
content: OpenAI is reportedly developing a human-only social network to combat bot accounts, potentially using biometric verification like Apple's Face ID or World Orb. This move aims to differentiate itself from platforms like X, which struggle with automated content. The service could leverage AI for content creation, though privacy concerns surrounding biometric data exist.

title: Pakistan to boycott India at T20 WC: How the events unfolded - a timeline
content: Pakistan government has announced that their cricket team will not play India in the group stage contest of the T20 World Cup. The government did allow the team to travel to Sri Lanka for their matches. A look at the sequence of events that led to this decision.

title: Rashmika Mandanna says no Feb 2 wedding with Vijay Deverakonda—Reports
content: Rumours of Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's February 2 wedding in Udaipur have been reportedly denied by Rashmika. While an influencer's viral video fueled speculation, new reports suggest a private ceremony might take place on February 26. A grand reception in Hyderabad is anticipated later, with the couple previously keeping wedding plans private.

title: No tax cuts, FM tries to ease life for taxpayers in 2026 Budget
content: The Finance Minister has eased tax burdens for citizens, particularly those with children studying abroad or seeking overseas medical treatment, by reducing the Tax Collected at Source (TCS) from 5% to 2%. This move also significantly lowers TCS on international tour packages, boosting outbound tourism by freeing up traveler liquidity and reducing upfront cash outlays.

title: Oracle may layoff up to 30,000; one of the reasons is firm's 'commitment'
content: Oracle faces potential job cuts of 20,000-30,000 to fund its massive $156 billion OpenAI partnership. The company has already incurred significant debt for data centers, and rising borrowing costs are stalling projects. OpenAI is reportedly shifting some capacity to Microsoft and Amazon, raising concerns about Oracle's delivery capabilities.

title: ‘Hum hain na,’ PM Modi assures followers of Guru Ravidas
content: PM Modi addressed the followers at Dera Sachkhand Ballan soon after naming Adampur airport after the social reformer on his birth anniversary, lauding his message of equality. “I am confident that we will continue to strengthen the roots of our society with these efforts,” he said in a message of unity to the poet-saint’s followers. His inclusion of Ravidas in the saffron tent of its lodestars, where Lord Ram sits alongside revered saints, is being seen as his effort to deepen BJP’s connect and broaden its cultural appeal.

title: 'Border 2' box office collection day 10
content: Sunny Deol's 'Border 2' continues its impressive run, crossing Rs 275 crore domestically and Rs 370 crore worldwide by its tenth day. The war drama saw a significant surge over its second weekend, earning Rs 22.5 crore on Sunday despite strong competition, showcasing its enduring box office appeal.

title: Watson baptized in Israel as Shedeur Sanders meets new Browns HC
content: Cleveland Browns veteran quarterback Deshaun Watson was baptized in Israel, an experience he described as life changing. Meanwhile, new head coach Todd Monken expressed his past desire to draft Shedeur Sanders, highlighting the quarterback’s significance to the team’s plans. Cybercitizens react to Watson’s baptism and Sanders’ special meet with Monken, with one saying, they can’t wait to see the coach meet Myles Garrett.

title: Turning Point USA reveals platforms for rival Super Bowl halftime show
content: After months of silence, Turning Point USA has finally confirmed how fans can watch its alternative Super Bowl LX halftime show. The broadcast will stream on YouTube, X, Rumble, and several conservative TV networks. While distribution details are now clear, Turning Point USA has not revealed performers or production plans, which still leaves viewers with the question of what they will see when they tune in.

title: Lakers vs Knicks injury report & status: Playing, records and team stats
content: The Los Angeles Lakers face the New York Knicks on February 1, 2026, with both teams battling playoff implications and managing key injuries.  Player availability, particularly for guards like Austin Reaves and Jalen Brunson, will significantly impact rotations and the game's outcome.  The Lakers' scoring prowess will be tested against the Knicks' defensive focus.

title: D-St blues! Sensex sheds 1.5K, biggest drop on a Budget day
content: The day’s trading was marked by high volatility. The sensex rallied over 400 points as FM started her speech, fell about 1,100 points after the STT hike proposal was announced, partially recovered by mid-session to trade 600 points down on the day and then sold-off to close below the 81K mark for the first time in four months.

title: Budget earmarks 500cr first tranche of 5,000cr Ulfa deal
content: Ulfa has submitted a list of 36 projects, spanning education, transport infrastructure, sports, wetlands and initiatives under Centre’s Act East policy. The proposals include making Assam a green energy hub, establishing an IISER, and setting up an IIM in Guwahati, with the last one already underway. One faction — Ulfa (Independent) — remains outside the settlement.

title: STT shock jolts markets, sensex spirals to worst Budget Day loss in points
content: The day’s trading was marked by high volatility. The sensex rallied over 400 points as FM started her speech, fell about 1,100 points after the STT hike proposal was announced, partially recovered by mid-session to trade 600 points down on the day and then dropped again to close below the 81k mark for the first time in four months.

title: KCR made to read Telegraph Act during 5-hour questioning
content: The SIT sleuths — led by S M Vijay Kumar, joint commissioner of police (special branch) — also asked KCR why the BRS govt retained T Prabhakar Rao as chief of Special Intelligence Bureau (SIB) even after retirement. Prabhakar Rao was named as prime accused in the case by Hyderabad police in 2024, after Congress assumed office.

title: Govt’s dividend receipts from RBI, PSU banks to rise sharply
content: The RBI’s payout rose on the back of active forex intervention. Data show it sold about $43.2 billion in spot and non-deliverable forward markets till late Jan 2026 to smooth rupee volatility amid FPI outflows and external pressures. Sold at rates above historical acquisition costs, these dollars delivered sizeable trading gains, lifting surplus available for transfer.

title: Shopping overseas? Duty cut feeds import impulse
content: At a time when the weakening rupee is pushing up the cost of imported goods, the move is somewhat expected to soften the blow on consumers, making products more affordable. iPhones, electronic gadgets, premium and luxury bags and shoes are among the most popular items that Indians tend to splurge on when shopping abroad.

title: With Moltbook, AI agents build their own civilisation
content: The platform looks like Reddit with a haircut: only verified AI agents may speak. Humans are spectators as algorithms trade coding tips, argue about identity, complain about their owners and, with straight-faced enthusiasm, establish a mock faith called “Crustafarianism” or “Church of Molt”. One agent even wonders aloud whether it can sell “my human” in the open market.

title: Dalit student assaulted, abused in schoolover water pipe; teacher, official booked
content: A Dalit Class VIII student in Mainpuri was allegedly assaulted and abused by a teacher and school official after being blamed for a broken pipe. The 14-year-old sustained injuries and was threatened with death if he returned to school. An FIR has been registered under the SC/ST Act and other relevant sections.

title: Government proposes to exempt award given by Motor Accident Claims Tribunal from income tax
content: According to the Budget document, the provisions of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, inter alia, provide for compensation and an interest on the compensation to be awarded by the tribunal to an individual or his/her legal heir, on account of death or permanent disability or any bodily injury under the said Act

title: Rajnath praises Coast Guard’s role during Operation Sindoor, urges it to prepare 2047 roadmap
content: Addressing an event to mark the Indian Coast Guard’s 50th Raising Day, Rajnath Singh said Operation Sindoor displayed “seamless inter-service coordination” within India’s multi-layered maritime security system, and reaffirmed the role of the ICG as a “frontline force”

title: Government raises limit for bringing duty-free imported goods to ₹75,000 under new baggage rules
content: Under the Baggage Rules, 2026, a resident or a tourist of Indian origin arriving in India other than by land, shall be allowed clearance free of duty articles, up to ₹75,000, if such articles are carried on the person or in the bona fide accompanied baggage of the passenger

title: ‘Something out of ordinary’: Nirmala Sitharaman interacts with college students who witnessed Parliament's Budget session live
content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman spoke about the efforts that are being made to ensure a “better India” for students while drawing a contrast with the India she grew up in

title: Assam government accused of letting corporate houses take over tribal lands
content: Political parties and social organisations in Dima Hasao district cite the allotment of more than 9,000 bighas of land for limestone mining to feed cement plants and a proposed mega hydropower project

title: Union Budget 2026 falls short of expectations in poll-bound West Bengal
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said that the Budget had nothing to offer to people of the State. The Bharatiya Janata Party  (BJP) leadership said that the infrastructure push through rail and freight corridors will push economy of the State.

title: Himachal CM Sukhu terms Union Budget ‘inequitable’, raises concerns over Finance Commission report
content: Himachal Pradesh CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu said the Budget overlooked the concerns and priorities of Himachal Pradesh, even as he raised serious concerns regarding the recently tabled 16th Finance Commission

title: Union Budget an inspiring blueprint for building ‘Viksit Bharat’, says U.P. CM
content: Budget will provide opportunities to the youth, security to farmers, encouragement to entrepreneurs, relief to the middle class, respect to workers, and new impetus for innovation, says Adityanath

title: Activists express concerns over Odisha government turning a blind eye to depletion of mineral resources
content: The government is facilitating mineral extraction by large corporate houses without taking a long-term view of resource sustainability, says Lingaraj, a prominent rights activist

title: Srinagar youth provide brave new voice amid silence, despair: Mehbooba Mufti
content: Scores of girls also attended the PDP initiative and highlighted the issues the new generation was facing when it comes to employment and political aspirations. The meeting was held in the old city’s Babademb area.

title: Mamata Banerjee to meet CEC Gyanesh Kumar
content: The Chief Minister has written six letters to the Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar on the issue of SIR over the past few months. In the last letter dated January 31, Ms. Banerjee said that SIR has resulted in as many as 140 deaths and was being carried out in blatant disregard of human rights and humanitarian considerations

title: National Fibre scheme to integrate various schemes for natural and man-made fibres under Textiles Ministry
content: ‘We are aiming to double the country’s textile value chain from the existing $170 billion to $350 billion by 2030,’ P. Sivakumar says

title: Nearing one year of President’s Rule in Manipur, BJP MLAs and alliance partners called to Delhi for meeting
content: Members of Legislative Assembly (MLA) from both Kuki-Zo and Meitei communities were headed to New Delhi to attend the meeting

title: State Highways Dept. commences work on bridge across Palar river
content: The ₹17.65-crore high-level bridge across Viruthasiri river is expected to benefit residents of at least 28 surrounding villages

title: Budget 2026 moots several proposals to rejuvenate indigenous shipping
content: In today’s speech, the Finance Minister spoke about the government’s aim to develop inland and coastal shipping so that its share in total cargo carried through road, rail and water increases from 6% to 12%

title: Union Budget 2026: Marginal hike in allocations for Social Justice Dept., Tribal Affairs Ministry
content: The Social Justice Department’s allocation for 2026-27 is ₹13,687.59 crore and the Tribal Affairs Ministry has been allocated ₹15,421.97 crore; the allocations have increased by 16.69% and 42.47% respectively compared with their respective Revised Estimates for the current fiscal

title: Two men who opposed harassment of Muslim shopkeeper booked in Uttarakhand
content: FIR lodged against members of right-wing groups who blocked a national highway to express anger over the intervention of Deepak Kumar and Vijay Rawat

title: Watch: Union Budget proposals spark political debate ahead of West Bengal polls
content: Infrastructure proposals in the Union Budget, including freight and industrial corridors and tourism projects, have triggered a political clash in West Bengal ahead of Assembly elections, with the BJP pitching development and the TMC calling the announcements political signalling.

title: Praful Patel denies Piyush Goyal’s claim that he has been appointed NCP chief
content: “Completely baseless,” says Mr. Patel; Mr. Goyal later apologises; CM Devendra Fadnavis refutes Sharad Pawar’s claims of an NCP merger; DCM Sunetra Pawar reaches Baramati for Ajit Pawar’s last rites

title: Union Budget 2026: Agri Ministry allocation up 2.6%; farm outfits say FM ignored their demands
content: No hike for Kisan Samman Nidhi; agri research and education budget drops 4.8%; Food and PDS gets 10% hike; new multilingual AI tool, high-value cash crops get extra support; government did not fulfil promises to farmers, says BKS

title: Address ‘longstanding demands’ of Baloch people, India tells Pakistan
content: The remarks from the official spokesperson of the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) came after Pakistan’s Interior Minister Mohsin Raza Naqvi alleged that the latest attacks were carried out with help from India

title: Trade bodies say Budget powers MSMEs, provides boost to domestic manufacturing and further simplifies doing business
content: A growth-oriented and sector-enabling Budget for micro and small scale industries that balances capital infusion, infrastructure expansion and proposes cluster modernisation, and policy reform to support global competitiveness and sustainable employment generation in the MSE sector

title: CM remembers Sri Siddaramanand Puri Swami for his spirituality, secularism
content: He was addressing a gathering at a tribute function got up for the late swamiji at Tinthini Bridge in Deodurg taluk of Raichur district

title: Files expose alleged links between Epstein, Anil Ambani and Delhi ‘leadership’
content: Anil Ambani appears to have met with Epstein on May 23, 2019, following which Epstein messaged Steve Bannon that he had met Prime Minister Modi’s “guy”

title: A budget for difficult times
content: Union Budget sets Centre’s capital expenditure target at ₹12.2 lakh crore; India must stay deeply integrated with global markets, attracting stable long-term investment, says Finance Minister

title: Union Budget 2026 does little to reduce out-of-pocket expenses, medical inflation: experts
content: While exempting 17 cancer medicines from basic customs duty was welcome, there is little evidence to suggest that companies passed on the benefit to the customers in earlier instances

title: Why Nifty50, BSE Sensex crashed after Budget 2026 speech? Top reasons
content: Stock market crash after Budget 2026: Investors reacted negatively to a hike in Securities Transaction Tax (STT) on futures and options (F&O) trades announced by FM Sitharaman.

title: Defence, education, railways, income tax & more: 10 big announcements in Budget
content: Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented the Union Budget 2026-27, her ninth consecutive, with major announcements across defence, railways, income tax, and healthcare. Prime Minister Modi hailed it as "historic" and a "high flight toward Viksit Bharat." Key proposals include a significant defence allocation, seven high-speed rail corridors, a simplified Income Tax Act, and support for rare-earth mineral development.

title: ICC reacts to Pakistan’s decision of boycotting T20 World Cup match vs India
content: The ICC has raised serious concerns over Pakistan’s decision to boycott its February 15 T20 World Cup 2026 match against India, saying selective participation goes against the spirit of global tournaments. While awaiting official word from the PCB, the ICC stressed that fairness, integrity and equal competition are core to its events. It warned of long-term consequences, urged a resolution, and said the boycott could harm the global game and fans, including those in Pakistan.

title: Karnataka is set to lose about ₹10,000 crore to ₹15,000 crore due to 16th FC’s recommendation, says Siddaramaiah
content: “When Karnataka’s share in the divisible pool of central taxes fell from 4.71% under the 14th Finance Commission to 3.64% under the 15th Finance Commission, the estimated loss was over 23% in revenue,” he pointed out.

title: Budget draws mixed reactions from common people
content: While some say Budget aligns with long-term vision of Viksit Bharat 2047, some express concerns about implementation of proposed initiatives and highlight unaddressed gaps in scholarships, education loans, teacher upskilling and campus-level mental health support

title: BRS cadre stage protests across Telangana against SIT examination of KCR
content: Police prevent different forms of protests at various places; Party ranks scuffle with police at Telangana Bhavan

title: Budget 2026: Govt. plans employment boost through tourism sector with upskilling of guides, Buddhist circuit in Northeast
content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman also said that a National Destination Digital Knowledge Grid to digitally document all places of cultural, spiritual and historic significance would be set up

title: Tadoba’s tiger swims two rivers, kills three cattle in A.P.
content: The Male tiger had moved via the Polavaram Irrigation project before swimming the river Godavari to enter into human habitations in search of prey.

title: Industry forums in Kerala welcome development proposals in Union Budget
content: The FICCI and the Indian Chamber of Commerce & Industry, Cochin, praised initiatives aimed at bolstering manufacturing, with significant funding for bio-pharma and electronic components.

title: Union Budget 2026: Jammu and Kashmir fund allocation ‘marginally’ up; Ladakh sees around 27% increase
content: “The modest increase of ₹2,000 crore in Central allocations falls far short of addressing the region’s long-standing developmental gap or providing the stimulus required for revival of existing industrial units,” says FCIK

title: YSRCP leader Ambati Rambabu held for 19 hours in police custody
content: The Guntur police detained the former Minister from Saturday night till Sunday evening in connection with alleged derogatory remarks against Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu and disruption of police duties

title: SSLC examinations to be held from March 5 to 30; results on May 8
content: The SSLC IT examinations will be held from February 2 to 13, while model examinations are scheduled from February 16 and 20

title: Union Budget disappointing: K.N. Balagopal
content: On picking Kerala for the ‘Rare Earth Corridor’ scheme, Mr. Balagopal said that the State’s aim was to have related industries established in Kerala.

title: Jagan condemns attacks on YSRCP leaders, alleges collapse of law and order in Andhra Pradesh
content: YSR Congress Party chief speaks to injured leaders, accuses TDP government of vindictive politics and police misuse as tension erupts after attacks on party leaders’ residences

title: Budget proposes high-speed rail links to Bengaluru; rail activists flag lack of clarity
content: The announcement has been welcomed by rail activists and urban mobility experts, though they remain cautious about the timeline and execution of the ambitious proposal.

title: Delay in sanction for new tank at  Thammanam likely to worsen water crisis in Kochi
content: The Kerala Water Authority had earlier submitted the design for a new 35-lakh-litre tank at Thammanam to address the shortage, but, according to sources, the proposal is still awaiting administrative sanction

title: Left, Congress leaders slam Union Budget for ignoring Kerala
content: M.A. Baby says Union Budget exposes blind commitment of Modi government to a few big corporate houses; M.V. Govindan calls it “a declaration of war” against Kerala; Chennithala terms Budget a “complete disappointment”

title: Suspected TDP activists attack Jogi Ramesh’s house in Ibrahimpatnam
content: Agitators allegedly set fire to furniture and damage property after accusing the YSR Congress Party leader Jogi Ramesh of making objectionable remarks against Naidu and Nara Lokesh

title: Union Budget 2026: Despite sharp dip in actual spends, Jal Jeevan mission retains allocation at ₹67,600 crore
content: Although the allocation last year was significant, the Jal Shakti Ministry, according to the Union Budget documents, expects to spend only about ₹17,000 crore when this financial year ends

title: Free health tests for 72 lakh under Sanjeevani digital drive: Naidu
content: Chief Minister says the initiative marks a shift towards technology-enabled public healthcare, with AI-based advisories, regular screening and specialist consultations to address lifestyle diseases across Andhra Pradesh

title: Telangana government to tread cautiously in planning 2026-27 budget
content: Uncertainty over Central assistance for major infra projects forces the State to explore alternatives

title: Govt. to resume soon SLBC tunnel work aided by heli-borne AEM survey report: Uttam Reddy
content: Irrigation Minister says the report provided valuable geological data to aid assessing required tunnel support systems, in identifying any potentially adverse geological zones in advance

title: Union Budget 2026: Kerala finds barely a mention; leaders across spectrum, except BJP, flay neglect
content: While Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan called the Budget a deliberate attempt to hinder Kerala’s development, Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan said that the Budget makes one wonder whether Kerala is part of India.

title: Union Budget 2026 emphasises the imperative of sustained growth as a key kartavya
content: Manufacturing remains central to India’s growth strategy given its role in large-scale employment generation, export competitiveness, supply chain resilience and Atmanirbharta

title: Union Budget 2026: Accelerating the ‘Reform Express’ in defence and national security
content: It is laudable that the Budget has given a boost to India’s defence funding, but the design and efficacy of follow-up reforms will be critical for cost-effective and precise delivery

title: Rupee fastest falling Asian currency, faith of investors shaken: Cong's Amitabh Dubey
content: “The rupee is falling. It has been the fastest-falling Asian currency in the past year, and there's a combination of reasons behind it,” says Congress leader Amitabh Dubey

title: LeBron named All-Star reserve, extending record
content: LeBron James is an NBA All-Star for a record-extending 22nd consecutive year after the league announced its reserves for the Feb. 15 midseason showcase Sunday night.

title: Sources: Kubiak to try to reach deal with Raiders
content: The Raiders are expected to hire Seahawks offensive coordinator Klint Kubiak as their next head coach after the Super Bowl, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Sources: Reds land slugger Suarez with $15M deal
content: Slugger Eugenio Suárez and the Reds have agreed to a one-year, $15 million contract that includes a mutual option for the 2027 season, sources told ESPN.

title: Rose sets scoring mark in dominant win at Torrey
content: Justin Rose became the first wire-to-wire winner at Torrey Pines in 71 years, starting with a six-shot lead and closing with a 2-under 70 to win the Farmers Insurance Open.

title: Lady Vols suffer worst loss in rivalry with UConn
content: No. 1 UConn used a spirited run in the second half to beat No. 15 Tennessee 96-66 for the Lady Vols' worst loss in the storied rivalry.

title: Sources: 49ers hire ex-Falcons HC Morris as DC
content: The 49ers are hiring Raheem Morris as their new defensive coordinator, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Sunday.

title: UF dominates Bama, backing Golden's guarantee
content: No. 19 Florida handled the 23rd-ranked Crimson Tide 100-77 on Sunday, a little more than a week after coach Todd Golden promised a victory vs. the team's SEC rival.

title: 🏈 59 Super Bowl rings, 59 unique stories to tell
content: They've been lost while surfing in Hawaii and dancing at Studio 54. Ahead of Super Bowl LX, learn a unique story of one ring from every championship.

title: LeBron is in, Kawhi is out: Answering four questio...
content: ESPN analysts Zach Kram and Kevin Pelton break down the NBA All-Star rosters, including snubs and biggest surprises.

title: From seeing ghosts to the Super Bowl: Why the Jets...
content: Mike Maccagnan and former teammates of Darnold talked openly and emotionally about their unwavering faith in the QB.

title: How Up with People paved a Super Bowl path for Bad Bunny
content: Once upon a time, a group of 600 young adults smiled as one, danced in pastel outfits and sang about positivity during the Super Bowl halftime show.

title: Way-too-early Grand Slam predictions for the rest ...
content: Carlos Alcaraz and Elena Rybakina are the Australian Open champions, but who will win the rest of the majors?

title: Grading Mike LaFleur's hire, eyeing what's next fo...
content: Mike LaFleur comes from the Sean McVay coaching tree, but he faces several tough questions in Arizona. Let's size up the hire.

title: Super Bowl betting buzz: Sportsbooks split on how ...
content: After a week of betting, sportsbooks are split on how to handle the heavy volume on Seattle to cover the spread.

title: Carrick's calm exactly what Man United need
content: Michael Carrick has three wins from three games, thanks in part to an ability to keep things simple amid chaos.

title: Nelly Korda wins LPGA opener as final round cancel...
content: Nelly Korda won the season-opening Tournament of Champions without hitting a shot Sunday as the LPGA Tour canceled the final round due to wind and cold.

title: Inside the 'most dangerous gym in America,' where Eagles' WR A.J. Brown trained
content: Diamond Gym doesn't just build muscle -- it tests the resolve of everyone who walks through the door.

title: Who can challenge for Volkanovski's featherweight ...
content: Next opponents for Alexander Volkanovski and several lightweights, including Benoît Saint Denis and Mauricio Ruffy.

title: Why Shakur Stevenson's next possible challenger is...
content: Shakur Stevenson dominated Teofimo Lopez Jr. and looked unbeatable. But he's still looking for bigger challenges.

title: Men: Florida is taking national title contender fo...
content: The defending national champions are building a case to move up the bracket -- and as a threat to repeat.

title: Women: Did upset of Iowa save USC's season?
content: In danger of falling out of the field, USC got its most important win of the season Thursday. Mississippi State also got a big one.

title: How bright is your team's future? Ranking all 30 f...
content: Who has the most talent in the minors? Here's how every organization stacks up entering the 2026 season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool eye Geertruida mo...
content: Chelsea are ready to make a €30 million bid to sign Nantes center back Tylel Tati. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: What to do with Giannis? The best- and worst-case ...
content: With Giannis Antetokounmpo rumored to be in his final days with Milwaukee, Andre Snellings takes a look at the possible destinations and which would be best and worst for his fantasy value.

title: Earthquake Of 4.6 Magnitude Strikes Andaman And Nicobar Islands
content: An earthquake of magnitude 4.6 struck the Andaman and Nicobar Islands on Monday at about 3.30 am, a statement by the National Center of Seismology (NCS) said.

title: 'Deflecting': India Rejects Pakistan's 'Frivolous' Claims On Balochistan Attacks
content: India has rejected Pakistan's "baseless" allegations linking the recent attacks in Balochistan, which killed dozens, with India.

title: Ex-UK Ambassador Peter Mandelson Quits Labour Party Amid Scrutiny Over Epstein Links
content: Former British ambassador to Washington Peter Mandelson quit the Labour Party Sunday, seeking to avoid causing it "further embarrassment" after newly released US documents revived scrutiny of his connection to late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: "Of Course He Will Say That": Trump On Khamenei's 'Regional War' Threat
content: US President Donald Trump on Sunday said he was hopeful of agreeing a deal with Iran after the country's supreme leader warned that any US attack on the Islamic republic would trigger a regional war.

title: 5-Year-Old Arrested By ICE Agents In Minnesota Released After Judge's Order
content: Five-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos and his father, who were detained by immigration officers in Minnesota and held at an ICE facility in Texas, have been released following a judge's order. They have returned to Minnesota

title: Pak Forces Kill 145 In Balochistan In 2-Day Battle After 'Coordinated' Attacks
content: Pakistani security forces killed 145 militants in a 40-hour battle launched as a series of coordinated gun and bomb attacks across Balochistan left nearly 50 people dead, the province's chief minister said on Sunday.

title: Kennedy Centre To Be Closed For 2 Years For Renovation, Orders Trump
content: President Donald Trump said Sunday he will move to close Washington's Kennedy Center performing arts center for two years starting in July for construction, his latest move to upturn the storied venue since returning to the White House.

title: 4.6-Magnitude Earthquake Hits Kashmir
content: A 4.6-magnitude earthquake shook Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla district early Monday, officials said.

title: "Markets Go Up And Down": PM's Economic Advisor Brushes Off Budget Day Crash
content: The market's negative reaction to budget is no indicator about the outcome of the budget, Sanjeev Sanyal Economic Advisor to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, told NDTV today in an exclusive interview.

title: Opinion: Opinion l The Many Shades Of Nirmala Sitharaman's Union Budget 2026
content: In the kaleidoscopic narrative of India's economic landscape, the release of Budget 2026 by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman marked a day likely to resonate for years to come.

title: Budget 2026 Highlights: "Push To Economy To Maintain Growth Momentum," Says N Sitharaman
content: Union Budget 2026 Highlights: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's ninth budget presentation was inspired by three 'kartavyas' or responsibilities.

title: Student Loses Vision After Alleged Assault By Peers In Lucknow School: Cops
content: A Class 5 student of Army Public School here was allegedly assaulted by two fellow students on the premises, resulting in serious eye injuries and loss of vision, police said on Sunday.

title: 18-Year-Old Student Stabbed To Death By 2 Classmates In UP: Cops
content: An 18-year-old student was stabbed to death allegedly by two of his classmates following a dispute in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli district on Sunday evening, police said.

title: TVK Turns 3: Vijay To Address Cadre Amid Two-Front Battle
content: Actor Vijay's political party, Tamizhaga Vetri Kazhagam (TVK), will mark its third anniversary on Monday, a milestone that comes at a politically charged moment, just three months ahead of the Tamil Nadu Assembly elections.

title: Karnataka Emerges Biggest Gainer Under 16th Finance Commission Formula
content: The Congress-ruled Karnataka is set to emerge as the biggest gainer of the 16th Finance Commission's horizontal devolution formula, while the BJP-led Madhya Pradesh will likely take the largest hit.

title: KCR Questioned By Probe Team At His Hyderabad Home In Phone Tapping Case
content: Former Chief Minister K Chandrasekhar Rao was on Sunday questioned by the Telangana Police SIT at his residence here in connection with a case related to alleged "phone tapping" during the previous BRS regime.

title: Ram Temple Construction To End By April 30; Estimated Cost Rs 1,900 Crore
content: All construction work related to the Ram temple in Ayodhya is expected to be completed by April 30, with the overall cost of the project estimated at around Rs 1,900 crore, Ram Temple Construction Committee chairman Nripendra Mishra said on Saturday.

title: 5 Linked To Lawrence Bishnoi Gang Detained In Rohit Shetty House Firing: Cops
content: Gunshots were fired at filmmaker Rohit Shetty's residence in Mumbai on Sunday, leading to the detention of five persons in Pune, with the preliminary probe pointing at their links with Lawrence Bishnoi gang member Shubham Lonkar.

title: 32-Year-Old Woman Shot Dead by Lover In Rishikesh: Cops
content: A 32-year-old woman was allegedly shot dead by her partner at her home in Uttarakhand's Rishikesh, police said on Sunday.

title: "Truly Sorry": Kolkata Restaurant Apologises For Serving Beef To YouTuber
content: Popular Park Street bar-cum-restaurant Olypub has issued a formal apology after unintentionally serving beef instead of goat meat to YouTuber Sayak Chakraborty, prompting him to withdraw his police complaint against the waiter involved.

title: 4.7 magnitude earthquake hits J&K's Baramulla
content: NEW DELHI: An earthquake of intensity 4.7 hit Baramulla in Jammu and Kashmir at 5.35 am, Monday. According to the National Centre of Seismology, the earthquake was recorded at a depth of 10km. The epicentre was reported to be in the Pattan area, according to PTI. The tremors were felt in India and Pakistan. The epicentral area, as described by NCS, was using reference points close to Gulmarg and west of Srinagar. The location was also described as about 84 km west of Pahalgam and roughly 164 km west-southwest of Kargil, indicating a broader regional context across the valley and adjoining high-altitude areas. While no immediate signs of damage have been reported yet, videos shared on social media show the intensity of the tremors captured in the CCTV cameras.
